Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response:
I have only ever really used GenAI for proofreading / tone correction when writing a report etc. I will generally use some of the changes it suggests, but they are generally not very impactful. I can definitely say GenAI has not had an impact on my learning.

All of my notes and content I get comes from my teachers, and they are the ones who are contributing to my learning. Hence I would say teachers have the largest impact on my learning, while AI has very little / none.

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response: It feels actually useful when coming from a teacher, whereas I never really trust what AI is telling me, and always end up doing the manual work to check what it is saying.

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response:
GenAI provides very general, and surface level feedback. Often it is generic and not really specific to what I am doing.

Comparatively, teachers can provide useful, in depth insights that are actually relevant to what I am learning.
